column4: hi guys. i've got a kernel compile that returns this error: any ideas why? ubuntu/ms/memstick.c:16:28: error: linux/memstick.h: No such file or directory :: ubuntu/ms/memstick.c:27: warning: struct memstick_device_id declared inside parameter list
missing declare in a header
that would be part of the code then?
either that or it conflicts with the headers you have installed on your ssytem
how do i set my headers and make them line up?
you can't really
I've told you
and i've removed all but the default headers.
1.) are you building a kernel or a module 2.) what module 3.) what kernel version
answer my questions
I'll ask you ago
1.) are you building a module or a kernel 2.) what module 3.)what kernel
1.) why are you building a kernel 2.) what version of the kernel
what slack are you cutting out ?
drivers that i won't load, and add drivers i do load into the kernel.
seems a pointless task when a.) you don't know how to debug the problems b.) you have no reason to do it
nope
the kernel tree is fine - hence why there is an existing kernel
you'r doing this from the vanilla kernel.org source ?
you're going to make things hard for you
my mistake, i got the source from Synaptec
ok - so the source tree is fine as thats the one used to build ubuntu kernels
